bug.short_desc: Double click close tab when only 2 tabs makes both tabs close.

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
If user has only 2 tabs open, and clicks almost at the speed of a double click the "X" on the left one, both tabs will close, resulting in Firefox closing.
Reproducible: Couldn't Reproduce
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open 2 tabs 2. Hover mouse over left tab's "x" (close button) 3. Click twice, just a little slower than a normal double click. Actual Results: Firefox closed.
Expected Results: The "x" close button should have disappeared faster. Or Firefox shouldn't be able to be closed by a tab's close button.
It could have just been a one of a time instance, but yeah, probably good to tell you.

I cannot see this problem with a 4.0 build on Linux. Can you please run Firefox in Safe Mode so we can ensure that this is not an issue raised by an extension? Thanks
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

(In reply to comment #1) > I cannot see this problem with a 4.0 build on Linux. Can you please run Firefox > in Safe Mode so we can ensure that this is not an issue raised by an extension? > Thanks > > http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode
Just did it in safe-mode. Successfully re-created. It's really hard to do, to be honest: you need to move the mouse a little to the right and click like crazy to re-create it - before the x button disappears - I guess the first time I did it it must have been REALLY lucky. Well, unlucky. It's probably not worth worrying about, just thought y'all might like to know about the bug.
